name: Mandalay Hill Resort

reviews.text: Country has energy crisis with blackouts being a norm. So, be prepared electricity failing once in a while during the day. As a result, rooms do smell a little damp.
reviews.title: nice but lacks charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are nice, but some details have not been thought through - bathroom switch is on the remote by the window, doors of the living room open inside blocking into the bed, etc
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with very accommodating staff

reviews.text: Also, selection of the room service is very limited.
reviews.title: Good but not all

reviews.text: Mini bar offeres great selection of the Myanmar wines. And really mean wines are very good.
reviews.title: Very good Hotel

reviews.text: I spent 3 nights at this hotel. It is very much a resort (not boutique) hotel. Good quality hotel, decent gym, but above all, very reliable and honest staff. I left my wallet in the room on departure and they had it shipped to me (at no charge) in Yangon! Really thanks to everyone at the hotel.
reviews.title: Service Extraordinaire

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed this very friendly hotel. Breakfasts were very good if somewhat chaotic if you happen to arrive when all the other tourists are eating early and ready to get on the road! The pool area is beautiful and the staff friendly and helpful. I booked a 2 hour Myanmar massage in the beautiful spa in the grounds of the hotel. I`m sure it did me some good but is was a dry massage over thin pajamas and very painful.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a couple of nights to see the sights. Room on 7 floor was good size but the bathrooms are small still has old plastic shower curtain in bath. No hot water for a while and safe jammed shut with our stuff in. Food in hotel is expensive get a cab and eat in the town and still save money.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.text: Breakfasts are ok.staff I met where helpful and good fun.
reviews.title: Fantastic Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't believe the hotel pictures on tripadvisor the pool area is very poor that's why there are no day time pictures. It's very tired large areas of concrete to few sunbeds and the towels have seen better days.
reviews.title: lovely hotel, great pool and garden area, friendly efficient happy staff,

reviews.text: Overall it's a tired hotel that needs some money spent on it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel -- with a touch of local color
Lovely pool and views!
reviews.text: This is a high rise establishment set in lovely gardens with a good swimming pool. The location necessitates a taxi ride to central Mandalay.
Our pleasant, spacious 3rd floor room faced the hill and overlooked the pool and gardens. Beds were comfortable, and bedside lighting was excellent, however towels were threadbare and grey.
reviews.title: The place is beautiful but expensive

reviews.text: A wide variety of western and eastern food was available at breakfast.
reviews.title: modern and not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet dinner was excellent for a “buffet”, with a massive array of hot and cold dishes – meat, fish and vegetarian. The vegetarian salads were exceptional.
reviews.title: Lovely surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only one of the two lifts was operational during our visit.
reviews.title: Very decent
Good Enough
reviews.text: Nice view from 605. Room was fine. Clean. Showing some wear and tear. Some in my group complained of rooms being too cold, but no problem with mine. Two bottles of water per day free. Minibar (overpriced). Laundry service efficient but expensive. Coffee and tea-making facilities in room. Plenty of hot water. Hairdryer in room.Towels and linens are ok. Bath toiletries are pretty inexpensive. Lovely pool area. In-room safe did not work. Wifi rarely works in the rooms; works ok in the lobby area. Loud chanting and/or music going all night outside. Americans won’t need an electrical adapter.

reviews.title: The best in Mandalay, but ageeeeed!
reviews.text: Major problem – 2 elevators for 200+ rooms!?

reviews.title: Oasis of Calm amid Beautiful Grounds
reviews.text: This property are close to the Mandalay town center, but expect you are in Myanmar and the hotels are very old generally.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel for local standard
reviews.text: Fantastic wi-fi speed for the country.

reviews.title: Royal British Legion - Remembrance Travel
reviews.text: Fantastic SPA.

description: Crescent shaped Hotel situated at the foot of picturesque Mandalay Hill, near the Mandalay Royal Palace.
